original_title: ‘Fueling the Future: Join industry leaders in exploring the intersection of agriculture, technology, and food security’
original_body_lines: The Institute of Food Science and Technology Sri Lanka (IFSTSL) is steadfast in its mission to bolster the Sri Lankan economy and facilitate the achievement of global standards in food processing. In pursuit of these goals, IFSTSL is pleased to announce its upcoming industrial seminar, featuring a distinguished lineup of industry experts. Esteemed personalities such as:
Mario De Alwis- Managing Director of Ma’s Tropical Food Processing Pvt Ltd,
Prof. Anoma Chandrasekara- Professor in Food Science & Nutrition at Wayamba University of Sri Lanka,
Senior Prof. & Chair K.K.D.S. Ranaweera- University of Jayewardenepura, and
Dhammika Gunasekara- Managing Director of Tropical Life Pvt Ltd will grace the event as speakers.

This highly anticipated seminar, centered around the theme of ‘leveraging agriculture and technology for food security,’ is scheduled to take place at the Profood/Propack Exhibition 2023. The seminar is scheduled for August 4th, 2023, from 1:00 PM to 5:00 PM at the Mihilaka Medura BMICH, meticulously organized by the Institute of Food Science and Technology Sri Lanka.

This seminar presents a rare opportunity for attendees to engage with industry experts in an intimate and focused forum. Participants will have the privilege of spending four hours with these renowned individuals, facilitating easy interaction, the sharing of ideas, and the opportunity to pose questions during this singular knowledge sharing session.

Given the prevailing challenges faced by Sri Lanka, including the potential issues of food scarcity and rising prices, this seminar is perfectly timed. It provides an ideal platform to address these critical concerns and explore strategies to ensure food security. Notably, the invitation extends not only to companies and investors within the food processing industry but also to individuals from various sectors who recognize the significance of tackling these challenges collectively. Let us seize this occasion to address current issues and work towards a more secure and sustainable food future.

Registration for this exceptional knowledge sharing session is priced at LKR 3500 representing an excellent value for the unique opportunity to engage with industry leaders. Don’t miss out on this transformative event that promises to deliver valuable insights and foster collaboration.
For further information and registration inquiries, please reach out to us at nadeeka@saexhibitions.com.
